items.title: What New York City’s Sewers Reveal About the Virus
items.abstract: The pungent underground waterways, known for alligator tales and other lore, are routinely tested for traces of the coronavirus.

items.title: New York Police Begin Using ShotSpotter System to Detect Gunshots
items.abstract: As part of a pilot program, sensors are being placed in precincts in the Bronx and in Brooklyn, a total area of 15 square miles, where there have been a high number of shootings.

items.title: Angkor’s Urban Environs, Mapped From Above
items.abstract: Using airborne laser-scanning technology, archaeologists have been able to map the highly engineered landscape now hidden under jungle and rice fields that surrounded the ancient temple complex.
keywords: Laser (Light Amplification by Stimulated Emission of Radiation)
Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences

items.title: Daily Report: Fears for Privacy as Cities Widen Surveillance Efforts
items.abstract: A program in Oakland is one of the latest and most contentious examples of cities using big data technology, and federal dollars, for routine law enforcement.

items.title: 2015 Hyundai Sonata: Modern Maturity for Fluidic Sculpture Design
items.abstract: The popular midsize sedan is refreshed, with new styling, for 2015.
